abstract_summ: Although a stable team is deemed optimal for agile project success, new team members need to join ongoing agile projects.When large industrial organizations change to (or start with) an agile approach to operations, managers and some employees are supposed to be “agile leaders” often without being given a clear definition of what that comprises when building agile teams.However, when multiple agile teams work on the same product, a higher coordination effort is required and more formal practices are applied.The results suggest that leader mitigation of these three aspects of group dynamics is essential to the success of an agile transformation.Within the agile paradigm, many software product companies create cross-functional product development teams that own their product or a defined set of product features.
